project.name: SALTY - E-commerce Website
project.description: My 1st project is an e-commerce website called SALTY, Designed and developed a fully responsive e-commerce frontend website using pure HTML, CSS, and Vanilla JavaScript. The project simulates a complete online shopping experience without relying on external frontend frameworks.
features: Dynamic Product Rendering: Implemented a custom routing system using URL parameters (URLSearchParams) to handle product search, category filtering, and detailed product views dynamically from a JSON data structure.
State Management: Developed a persistent Shopping Cart system using the browser's localStorage to handle adding/removing items and updating quantities across different sessions.
Interactive UI/UX: Built a custom JavaScript Carousel class, simulated payment processing modals, and added micro-interactions (e.g., "flying to cart" animation) to enhance user engagement.
Responsive Design: Utilized CSS Grid and Flexbox with a mobile-first approach, ensuring seamless rendering across desktop, tablet, and mobile devices.
Performance OptimizationModern CSS: Implemented CSS Variables (:root) for consistent theming and maintainability.

project.name: SkillFrameX - Online Learning Platform
project.description: SkillFrameX is a modern online learning platform developed with Next.js (App Router) and TypeScript. The project focuses on providing a seamless user experience for browsing courses, reading blogs, and tracking learning progress. It features a responsive design and efficient state management to handle dynamic content.
features: Dynamic Course Filtering & Search: Implemented a robust filtering system using `useSearchParams` to handle search queries and category selection, allowing users to filter courses by name, description, or category with shareable URLs.
Interactive Hero Slider: Built a custom carousel component with auto-sliding capabilities, manual navigation controls, and smooth CSS transitions to highlight featured courses.
Learning Progress Tracking: Integrated a custom hook (`useProgress`) to manage user enrollments and calculate real-time course completion percentages based on finished lessons.
Responsive Navigation: Designed a sticky navigation bar with a glassmorphism effect, featuring a real-time search input and a mobile-responsive menu that adapts to different screen sizes.
Asynchronous Data Loading: Utilized `Promise.all` to fetch course and category data concurrently, optimizing the initial page load performance.
